bcl:definition.bcl:text: land does not include buildings, houses or other depreciable improvements;

restricted contribution means a contribution that is subject to a legislative or contractual stipulation or restriction as to its use other than a contribution or part of a contribution that is of, or for the purpose of acquiring, land;
taxpayer-supported organization means a government organization that is within the taxpayer-supported government reporting entity.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Accounting policies and practices for restricted contributions

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In its accounts, a taxpayer-supported organization must report any restricted contribution received or receivable by it in accordance with the accounting policies and practices described in this section.

A restricted contribution received or receivable by a taxpayer-supported organization for the purpose of acquiring or developing a depreciable tangible capital asset or in the form of a depreciable tangible capital asset, in each case for use in providing services, is to be reported as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: it is to be treated as a deferred contribution;
the reduction of the liability and the recognition of the revenue are to be accounted for in the fiscal period during which the asset is used to provide services.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A restricted contribution received or receivable by a taxpayer-supported organization other than as described in subsection (2) is to be reported as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: it is to be treated as a deferred contribution;
the associated liability is to be reduced, and the associated revenue recognized, in the fiscal period during which the stipulation or restriction the contribution is subject to is met.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the net book value of a depreciable tangible capital asset of a taxpayer-supported organization related to a restricted contribution is reduced for any reason other than amortization, the accounts of the taxpayer-supported organization are to recognize a proportionate reduction of the liability associated with the contribution and a proportionate increase in the revenue associated with the contribution.
This section applies to the reporting of restricted contributions, whether they are received or receivable by a taxpayer-supported organization before or after this regulation comes into effect.
This section operates despite any Act other than the Budget Transparency and Accountability Act.
